content.text: Students review vocabulary and their understanding of the meaning of a range of words. Assign a set time for each of the tasks and 'keep the kettle boiling'!

This is a simple challenge - students write as many English words of three or more characters as they can in three minutes. You can increase the difficulty by only allowing words beginning with 'd' etc.
Explain the term 'closest meaning'. Students must choose the appropriate words on the worksheet. Give an example, perhaps with the first item on the worksheet. Give a set time to complete the task.
Students decide on the relationship of the pairs of words. Again, give an example first, then give a set time to complete the task.

Students list some similarities and differences between the pairs of words - for example a newspaper is daily whereas a magazine is monthly. Ask for three similarities and three differences for each, but be prepared to vary this task dependent on the time remaining.
Leave sufficient time at the end to review the answers and explain any misunderstandings.
